page.title: 16 Addey & Stanhope School
page.content: Addey & Stanhope School, a co-educational voluntary-aided secondary school in the New cross Rd, was formed in 1894 from 2 charity primary schools:the Stanhope school, founded 1715,& the John Addey school, founded 1820.Geo.Stanhope,Dean of Canterbury,was vicar of Lewisham & Deptford.Addey was an Elizabethan shipwright.In 1894 the school was a school for Art & Science.By 1944 it was a Grammar School & it became comprehen- sive in 1977. From 1924-56 BA Howard was HM.He encouraged co-education started foreign school journeys & intro -duced a Philosophy course for all 6th formers.He wrote"The Mixed School" & "The Proper Study of Man".From 1960-81 AR.Jenkins continued the liberal tradi- tions abolished the cane,gave senior boys & girls more subject choice includ -luding Woodwork & Home Economics.
